meanings.definition: A wrapped or boxed object or group of objects.
meanings.sent1: I received a package in the mail today.
meanings.sent2: The package contained a surprise gift.
meanings.sent3: The package was so big, it barely fit through the door!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a beautifully wrapped package.
meanings.sent5: The package was neatly tied with a bow, making it look special.

meanings.definition: A set of related items sold together.
meanings.sent1: The store offered a special package deal on the electronics.
meanings.sent2: The vacation package included flights and hotel stay.
meanings.sent3: Buying the package saved me money on each item individually.
meanings.sent4: The package of books was a treasure trove for book lovers.
meanings.sent5: The package deal was too good to pass up.

meanings.definition: To wrap or box something for transport or storage.
meanings.sent1: I need to package these cookies before they go stale.
meanings.sent2: She carefully packaged the fragile items for shipping.
meanings.sent3: He tried to package the oversized gift in a tiny box.
meanings.sent4: The memories were carefully packaged in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The company packaged the products in eco-friendly materials.
